title: Place to keep ammunition; penalty
context: [ยง134-27] Place to keep ammunition; penalty. (a) Except as provided in sections 134-5 and 134-9, all ammunition shall be confined to the possessor&rsquo;s place of business, residence, or sojourn; provided that it shall be lawful to carry ammunition in an enclosed container from the place of purchase to the purchaser&rsquo;s place of business, residence, or sojourn, or between these places upon change of place of business, residence, or sojourn, or between these places and the following: (1) A place of repair; (2) A target range; (3) A licensed dealer&rsquo;s place of business; (4) An organized, scheduled firearms show or exhibit; (5) A place of formal hunter or firearm use training or instruction; or (6) A police station. &ldquo;Enclosed container&rdquo; means a rigidly constructed receptacle, or a commercially manufactured gun case, or the equivalent thereof that completely encloses the ammunition. (b) Any person violating this section shall be guilty of a misdemeanor. [L 2006, c 66, pt of ยง1] Case Notes Discussed: 911 F. Supp. 2d 972 (2012).
